intro: Pavetta kisarawensis, commonly known as the Kisanawa pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kisanawa in the South Pacific. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy on the underside. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are clustered in umbels, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
